The curriculum of the EWYL Program is designed in a way where the culmination of theoretical learning coupled with practical application results in an outcome. The outcome can be learning a 21st-century skill or earning scholarship credits. For example, the explanation of Wednesday Lesson and Saturday Activity that was given to you back in early September might seem something that does not hold significant value at the first go, however, let me tell you that our team spends a lot of time in ensuring that they are jam-packed with employability skills as takeaways. You would be aware that it takes about 10,000 hours for a person to nail a skill and our method of habit creation through the one-on-one personalized mentorship sessions with the student will ensure the outcome.  The projects that I just explained above, teach one the entire spectrum of employability skills - communication, leadership, critical thinking, creative writing, etc. While a student may not understand the objective of the same immediately, it is my job as a mentor to ensure that the student always understands the intentions and outcomes behind any task that is assigned to him/her. 614 - 20 Dec 2023 10:05AM - +260 770170108: THE JOURNEY OF A MASTER PAINTER  Once upon a time in the bustling city of Etherville, there lived a young girl named Lily. Lily was known throughout the town for her unwavering integrity and diligent work ethic. She possessed a strong sense of honesty and took great pride in completing every task to the best of her ability.  One day, a prestigious art competition was announced, inviting artists from all over the land to showcase their talents. Lily, who had a deep passion for painting, saw this as an opportunity to demonstrate her skills and to inspire others through her art. Excitement filled her heart as she began to prepare for the competition.  With great diligence, Lily spent countless hours refining her technique and experimenting with different styles. She poured her heart and soul into each stroke of the brush, striving for perfection in every detail. Her dedication was unwavering, even when faced with obstacles and self-doubt.  As the day of the competition drew near, Lily unveiled her masterpiece‚Äîa breathtaking painting that depicted the harmony of nature and the resilience of the human spirit. Her artwork radiated with vibrant colors and conveyed a powerful message of hope and perseverance.  On the day of the competition, Lily's painting stood among numerous other magnificent artworks. The judges, renowned art connoisseurs, carefully examined each piece, searching for the one that truly embodied the virtues of integrity and diligence. As they deliberated, whispers filled the room, speculating on the artists behind the masterpieces.  When the time came to announce the winner, the room fell silent. The judges stepped forward, their faces reflecting a mix of awe and admiration. With a profound sense of gravity, they declared, "The winner of the art competition is Lily, for her incredible painting that beautifully captures the essence of integrity and diligence."  Tears of joy streamed down Lily's face as she accepted the award. Her hard work and unwavering commitment to her craft had paid off. She had become an inspiration not only to the artists present but to everyone who witnessed her dedication.  Lily's victory served as a reminder that integrity and diligence are not merely abstract concepts, but virtues that can be exemplified through one's actions. Her story spread across the city, inspiring others to embrace these qualities in their own lives.  From that day forward, Lily's artwork became a symbol of the transformative power of integrity and diligence. Her success was a testament to the belief that when one combines their talents with unwavering dedication, they can create something truly extraordinary and inspire others to do the same.  And so, Lily's legacy continued to echo through the ages, reminding generations to come of the virtues that lie within each individual‚Äîvirtues that have the power to shape the world for the better.

121 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: Let me brief you about the cost of higher education in India with respect to other countries and how Edoofa makes it affordable for students.
122 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: The cost of tertiary education in India is much lower than in Western countries. In India, the average cost of Higher Education for international students is around *6000-8000 USD*. In contrast, tuition fees for higher education in the UK, for example, can range from *USD 15000 to USD 35000*. Meanwhile, the US tuition cost is much higher, with the average cost of a 4-year degree ranging from *USD 80,000 to over USD 250,000.*
123 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: Now we wanted to make this cost of education even more affordable for the parents and students, *this is why our Parent Organisation Anhad Edutrain Solutions has worked with 250+ Universities for the last 14 years by helping them have the Employability Aspect in their education because of which from last 6 years Universities have been helping us to provide scholarship seats to the students so that their cost of education is reduced greatly.*
124 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
125 - 20 Dec 2023 11:25AM - Gurvinder: Therefore, for the selected students who are able to qualify for the EDOOFA Program by undergoing various tests, the cost comes down to $2000-$3000 per year. This cost includes:  *1. Remaining Tuition fees (if any)* *2. Basic University Expenses (Library, etc.)* *3. Food* *4. Accommodation*  *after this we give the opportunity to the students to reduce their remaining annual fee as much as they can through our Earn While You Learn Program.*
172 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
173 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
174 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: <Media omitted>
175 - 20 Dec 2023 03:54PM - Gurvinder: My experience says *consistency* is key to success in Edoofa's Earn While You Learn Program. By attending sessions regularly and seeking guidance from mentors, students can not just build their skill set but earn a higher amount of scholarship credits as well. *Our star performers, or Proud Edoodians, have earned up to $3000* in just one year by constantly asking for more projects and assignments to improve their performance. With Edoofa's financial aid, students can self-sponsor their higher education.  I hope you can now realize how we are different isn‚Äôt it something that you have been looking for regarding your international education?

181 - 20 Dec 2023 04:21PM - Gurvinder: Alright now as we have covered majorly everything from the counseling session, so let me help you understand how Edoofa makes the Application fee affordable for the students as well. However, for that you would have to be proactive for the next 20 minutes.  Are you ready?
190 - 20 Dec 2023 04:37PM - Gurvinder: Since you have understood how Edoofa has made the application process simpler and affordable for the student, let me share with you the payment policy of the same for your better understanding!
191 - 20 Dec 2023 04:37PM - Gurvinder: Birthwell basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.  *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out).  *Phase 3:* Once the final A level results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.  *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment itself.*
192 - 20 Dec 2023 04:38PM - Gurvinder: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. 261 - 20 Dec 2023 06:32PM - +263 78 313 4116: Name as per School Record- Gender-Famel Date of Birth as per School Record-10 August 2004 Father's Name-Kwanele Jonathan Dube Mother's Name-Sithembile Rosemary Senda Email Address- nodumophildube@gmail.com Parent's email address- sendarosemary@gmail.com/ Course: BA in sociology Intake Year: 2024 Country : India   1.A 2.D 3.C 4.B 5.B 6.A 7.B 8.√Ä 9.A 10.B 11.D 12.D 13.C 14.C 15.A 16.B   *Life in Rwanda 16 years after  the  genocide there*  Life in Rwanda after the genocide was not as lovely as it was as they had people who were suffering from depression and countless survivors developed long term psychological problem ,a number of children became orphaned,a number of women were raped and abused and had to heal from all these things not forgetting the economy of Rwanda was not stable after the genocide.....Rwanda suffered dearly in order to get back to the state they were once at  With the above stated on going problems in Rwanda is it easy for one to say Rwanda had a bad experience during the genocide.The issue of raped women and children is one serious matters as some of them may have been left with STI's and some of them suffered even facing other people in the community. 103 - 20 Dec 2023 11:34AM - Gurvinder: *What is BBA about?*  *Bachelor of Business Administration* is one of the most sought after bachelor degree programs aftment. The course is designed in a way to train students effectively in management education and communication skills which further inculcates entrepreneurship skills. It also gives you a platform for pursuing courses like MBA. To do well in this class 12th. It includes complete knowledge of leadership and management. The course can be pursued either Full-Time or Part-Time i.e. through Correspondence or Distance Education, depending on one‚Äôs preference. The maximum duration of the course is 5-years for those who wish to pursue it through correspondence or distance-learning mode.  *BBA* degree allows candidates to enter into the field of management and teaches them various aspects that are necessary for effective business manageield, students must possess leadership qualities, decision making skills, good oral and written communication skills   *Bachelor of Business Administration* course is designed to impart knowledge of skills in business management and administration.Throughout the duration of the course, students are regularly assessed through quizzes, class tests, viva, presentations, submission of assignments, performance in computer lab and practical. Most colleges also emphasize on a local project/ internship which is usually carried out after the fourth semester and this becomes a practical training project for the students. The final assessment for the course includes a minimum CGPA of 5.0 in all semesters, completion of the project work and lab practical.
104 - 20 Dec 2023 11:34AM - Gurvinder: *Career Prospects*  After successful completion of Bachelor of Business Administration course, graduates can either opt for higher education or seek employment in different sectors. Masters or post-graduation in Management Studies, Human Resource Development Management, Financial Planning and Wealth Management etc. are considered to be good options. Top recruiters for BBA graduates are Accenture, Genpact, TCS, HCL Technologies, International Business Machines (IBM) Corp to name a few. 78 - 20 Dec 2023 05:00PM - Gurvinder: A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

Students of BA in Travel and Tourism Management can also work in travel agencies where they accompany the passengers in exploring various places and cities. If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. Like animals, one stands still, powerless to move a step in fright or to lift a hand in defense of our lives, and sometimes one is seized with panic, and again, act more like the inferior animals than rational beings. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. Looking back at certain perilous moments in my own life, I remember them with a kind of joy, not that there was any joyful excitement then, but because they broadened my horizon, lifted me for a time above myself.  1. The author feels happy in the recollection of dangers faced and overcome because a) He felt elated as he was alive. b) They added a new perspective and lifted him above himself for a time. c) They brought him a new experience. d) These experiences boosted his confidence. 65 - 19 Dec 2023 10:04AM - Gurvinder: As much as I'd love to offer a pilot aviation course through the Edoofa program, it's important to note that the availability of courses under a scholarship program like Edoofa can be influenced by various factors. 62 - 20 Dec 2023 12:15PM - Gurvinder: A course in BA LLB is an exciting one that offers multiple career opportunities. The 5 key positions associated with this course are: *1) Legal Advisor* The main role of a legal advisor or legal counsellor is to offer legal advice and work, for organizations and the employees of the organization. Their services can be utilized by the Government, NGOs, other associations or large organizations. The legal advisors are in-house experts, in contrast to attorneys and supporters who offer their services to society in general. It is often seen that legal advisors were former advocates and therefore their skills and training have to be in accordance with those that are needed for attorneys and advocates. *2) Lawyer* As is evident by the title, is a person whose profession is law. There are different specializations for law including Cyber law, Environmental law, Company law, Criminal law and Family Law. Their main job role is to represent their clients in jurisdiction matters. Their work involves a lot of research, including that on the subject and their client‚Äôs perspective. They then go on to represent and defend their clients in the court. *3) Public Prosecutor* A Public Prosecutor is a criminal lawyer who is hired by the government. He may either be hired by the central or the state government to represent the interests of the state in any criminal trial. Their role starts once the police have investigated and filed the charge sheet in court. The expectation from the Public Prosecutor is that he acts in the interests of the general public and is fair and ethical. The criminal procedure code of 1973 under section 24, outlines the arrangements concerning the Public Prosecutor. *4) Judge* This role is considered to be very prestigious by any law student. Immediately after the completion of graduation, an individual can appear for a lower judiciary exam. The age group depending on different states varies between 21 to 35 years. The qualities of righteousness, good ethics and a passion for justice are some of the key qualities needed for this job. *5) Company Secretary* This job is for students who want to work in the corporate sector. This job requires a degree from ICSI or the Institute of Company secretaries of India. A lot of dedication and hard work is required to complete this course with your law degree, but on successful completion, this career can be extremely rewarding. A career in law is considered to be much sought after, satisfying and lucrative.

46 - 20 Dec 2023 12:28PM - Pallika Edoofa: A *B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology* is a 3-year undergraduate program that focuses on the skills and knowledge required to work in the field of clinical laboratory science. Medical laboratory technologists play a crucial role in the healthcare system by conducting various laboratory tests and analyses that assist in the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of diseases.  During the program, students are trained in various laboratory techniques, sample collection, testing procedures, and result interpretation. They learn how to handle and analyze different types of biological samples, such as blood, urine, tissue, and body fluids. *The curriculum also includes theoretical and practical courses in subjects like microbiology, biochemistry, hematology, immunology, and pathology.*  *Upon completion of the program, graduates can pursue careers as Laboratory Technicians, Laboratory Managers, Medical Officers, Research Associates, Medical Record Technicians, Resident Medical Officers, Lab Assistants, Laboratory Testing Managers, or even pursue teaching positions as Associate Professors or Lecturers in the field of medical laboratory science.*  Job opportunities for medical laboratory technologists can be found in a variety of settings, including hospitals, healthcare clinics, medical pathology laboratories, research laboratories, urologists' offices, and other healthcare facilities. They work closely with healthcare professionals, such as doctors and pathologists, to provide accurate and timely laboratory test results that contribute to patient care and treatment decisions.  *Overall, a B.Sc. in Medical Laboratory Technology provides graduates with the skills and knowledge necessary to perform laboratory tests, contribute to medical research, and make a valuable impact in the field of healthcare.*
